skill.name: changelog
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changelog, documenting releases, or reviewing commits/PRs for changelog entries.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changel...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network behavior is present. The skill contains guidance text only and shows no data theft patterns.

content.value_statement: You need accurate IdeaVim release notes without manual formatting. This skill guides changelog updates and mirrors them into changeNotes.
actual_capabilities: Structure entries under [To Be Released] with Features, Fixes, and Changes sections
Apply IdeaVim ticket and PR link formats for changelog lines
Exclude internal, test-only, and dependabot changes from user-facing sections
Insert the historical gap note for versions 2.10.0 through 2.27.0
Convert CHANGES.md content to HTML for build.gradle.kts changeNotes
limitations: Only supports the IdeaVim changelog format defined in the skill
Requires access to repository history to identify real changes
Does not run tests or validate build outputs
Does not generate release notes outside CHANGES.md and changeNotes

use_cases.title: Prepare a release section
use_cases.description: Draft the next version entry and ensure the [To Be Released] section is reset.

use_cases.title: Sync Marketplace notes
use_cases.description: Convert the changelog section into HTML changeNotes for plugin publishing.

use_cases.title: Review PRs for notes
use_cases.description: Identify which merged PRs should appear in Features, Fixes, or Merged PRs.

prompt_templates.title: Add a single fix
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner update to a small change
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Fixes entry for VIM-1234 describing that ci" now works in empty strings, and place it under [To Be Released].

prompt_templates.title: Draft a release section
prompt_templates.scenario: New version is ready for notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 2.28.0 section dated 2024-09-15 from recent commits and move current [To Be Released] items into it.

prompt_templates.title: Sync changeNotes
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the current [To Be Released] section into build.gradle.kts changeNotes HTML, preserving links and code formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Changelog review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review recent PRs since the last tag and list entries to add, excluding dependabot and internal refactors.

output_examples.input: Summarize the latest fixes for the [To Be Released] section.
output: Fixes: VIM-3456 Fixed cursor position after undo in visual mode
Fixes: VIM-3458 Fixed ci" command in empty strings
Changes: Note that the changelog gap applies to versions 2.10.0 through 2.27.0

best_practices: Use exact command examples from tests or code when describing fixes
Keep each change in only one section to avoid duplication
Preserve the changelog gap note between 2.9.0 and 2.28.0
anti_patterns: Logging internal refactors that users cannot observe
Rewriting PR titles in the Merged PRs section
Summarizing changeNotes instead of matching CHANGES.md

faq.question: Is this compatible with other projects?
faq.answer: No. It is tailored to the IdeaVim changelog and changeNotes format.

faq.question: What are the limits on entries?
faq.answer: Entries should be concise and only include user-visible changes or notable PRs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It references git and gh commands for workflow-based updates.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The instructions do not include credential or private file access.

faq.question: What if details are unclear?
faq.answer: Omit the entry rather than adding vague or unverifiable text.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic changelog tools?
faq.answer: It enforces IdeaVim-specific sections, links, and exclusion rules.
